answers.answer: Oh, and please excuse my misspelling in the title. :/

Try to calm down. i know its hard. the doctor is probably telling you the truth that the vile fell on the floor. i worked in the lab for a little bit mistakes happen. there's no cause for concern. just stay hydrated and calm. you'll be fine

well i dont think you should be worried about preeclampsia just yet but those are side effects of gestational diabetes...i just found out i have it and i am doing ok....dont panic.  call your dr and tell him your side effects...i am sure they will tell you not to worry til that glucose comes back

Just to be onthe safe side of having symptoms of Gestational Diabetese--I would just make sure you drink plenty of water, do light exercising(walking or swimming).  Try just watching what you eat--your symptoms were the same as mine for GD--cut out some of your sugars--sweets, carbs--I know it is hard--but this could be one of the worst case examples--take it a little easy and wait for the blood draw--they will tell you more.
Thanks everyone. I guess it does seem more like GD. I hope it's not, though. :/

question: I went in for my glucose screening a few weeks ago and everything seemed fine. Well, for the last couple of weeks I've been feeling really bad..stomach pain, constant headache, blurred vision and some dizziness and mild swelling. Well, my Dr office called me the other day to inform me that the screening needed to be redone because one of the nurses dropped a vile of my blood. I'm just worried that maybe there is a problem and they don't want to let me know yet. Do you guys think this is cause for concern?Thanks28w4d
title: Preelclampsia concerns
